result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie Ray Ashford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 02-16-17 or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie Ray Ashford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIXTY (60) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FORTY-FOUR (44) days time served.  STRAIGHT TIME.

OTHER CONDITIONS:

* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees by 02-16-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.

Attorney Barbara K Due in court, defendant Jessie Ray Ashford not in court, in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant is in custody due to a probation violation.  Defense requested a ONE (1) or TWO (2) week adjournment.  State is considering revocation.  State requested Defense be REMANDED.  Defense objected and requested a ONE HUNDRED DOLLAR ($100.00) CASH Bond.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED until the next hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defendant has not completed Community Service.  State requests brief adjournment to receive the final report.  Review hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Jessie Ray Ashford in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/7/15 @ 1:30pm
